channel.title: Welcome to TobyTime! on TobyTime
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to TobyTime! on TobyTime

item.title: Pacific Coast Highway Road Trip Part Two: Ragged Point, Cruikshank Trail
item.description: Ragged Point Following our peaceful night in Cambria, we eagerly resumed our journey along the Pacific Coast Highway. Our next destination was Ragged Point, a mere 30-minute drive from Cambria. However, as we arrived in the morning, a thick blanket of fog obscured the landscape. It seemed as if we had stumbled into a mysterious realm, walking through a magical forest shrouded in clouds. The silver lining was that the absence of crowds lent an almost ethereal quality to the experience.

item.title: Wyoming
item.description: Coming Soon in Fall 2023!

item.title: Pacific Coast Highway Road Trip Part One: Venice Beach, Santa Barbara, Cambria
item.description: Venice Beach While we’ve explored Venice Beach before, I couldn’t resist stopping by Eggslut for their amazing breakfast sandwich. For more details about spending a day in Venice Beach with your pup, check out this blog post! Santa Barbara After a couple of hours on the road from Venice Beach, we decided to take a break to stretch our legs and enjoy the coastal beauty at Shoreline Park. You can read about our previous trip to Santa Barbara for more dog-friendly spots in this blog post.

item.title: The Ultimate Dog-Friendly Pacific Coast Highway Road Trip
item.description: Welcome to our ultimate dog-friendly Pacific Coast Highway road trip, where we’ll embark on an incredible journey from Los Angeles to San Francisco, passing through some of California’s most iconic destinations. From the glitz of Los Angeles to the laid-back vibes of Santa Barbara, the rugged beauty of Big Sur, the enchanting charm of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the cultural richness of San Francisco, this adventure promises a diverse and exhilarating experience.

item.title: Dog-Friendly Yosemite: Day 2
item.description: On the second day of our trip to Yosemite National Park, Toby and I opted for a more tranquil and less crowded experience, away from the bustling Yosemite Village. We wanted to take it easy after an eventful first day. We began with a peaceful stroll along the scenic Wawona Meadow Loop trail, immersing ourselves in the serene beauty of the surroundings. Later, we embarked on a drive up to Glacier Point, making a stop at Washburn Point along the way to capture the breathtaking views.

item.title: Dog-Friendly Yosemite: Day 1
item.description: Our day began with capturing breathtaking moments at Tunnel View, where the grandeur of Yosemite unfolded before our eyes. Eager to explore further, we ventured into the valley and embarked on a delightful walk through Cook’s Meadow, leading us to the enchanting trail of Lower Yosemite Falls. After a lunch at Village Grill, we concluded this eventful day with a leisurely stroll to the lower loop of Mirror Lake. Tunnel View Leaving the cabin, we set off, heading north along the windy Wawona Road.

item.title: Dog-Friendly Itinerary to Yosemite
item.description: Yosemite National Park is a captivating wilderness that beckons nature enthusiasts from around the world. With its awe-inspiring granite cliffs, iconic waterfalls, ancient sequoia groves, and diverse wildlife, Yosemite is a testament to the raw beauty of the natural world. While most areas of Yosemite National Park have restrictions on dogs, there are still opportunities for you and your furry companion to explore and enjoy the natural wonders together. Let us guide you on a journey that showcases the dog-friendly side of Yosemite, so you can create your own unforgettable memories with your furry companions in this breathtaking wilderness.

item.title: Point Vicente in Rancho Palos Verdes
item.description: Rancho Palos Verdes, a scenic coastal city just south of Torrance, offers a slice of paradise with its stunning golf courses and trails along the Pacific Ocean. The best part? These trails are pup-approved, making it an ideal spot to treat your furry friend to a sensory adventure while you soak up the California sun on a leisurely stroll. Our Journey at Point Vicente On a beautiful Saturday afternoon, Toby and I decided to explore the beautiful trail near the Point Vicente Interpretive Center.

item.description: Coming Soon in Fall 2023!

item.title: Oregon
item.description: Coming Soon in Summer 2023!

item.title: California
item.description: Our Spots Check out the map below to see all the awesome places Toby and I have explored in California so far. It’s like our treasure map of beautiful parks and dog-friendly spots! Just click on the picture to open an interactive map in Google Maps, and you can start planning your own adventure-filled trips. Related Blogs If you want to dive into the details of our escapades in each of these spots, be sure to explore these blog posts!

item.title: Dog-Friendly Hike at the Will Rogers State Park
item.description: The Will Rogers Historic State Park is a stunning ranch once owned by the popular Hollywood actor in the 1920s-1930s, Will Rogers. This remarkable estate has been graciously donated to California State Parks following his death, offering visitors a chance to immerse themselves in its timeless allure. With an array of hiking trails to choose from, including some that connect to the adjoining Topanga State Park, Toby and I eagerly embarked on our exploration on the scenic Inspiration Loop Trail, a delightful dirt path that welcomes our furry companions on a leash.

item.title: First Sandy Walk at the Venice Beach
item.description: Calling all beach lovers! Venice Beach is a must-visit destination in southern California that you simply can’t miss. And guess what? I couldn’t resist the opportunity for Toby to get his paws in the sandy shores for the first time. Dog-Friendly Breakfast Spot Our day at Venice Beach started with a delightful breakfast at none other than the famous Eggslut. Despite the lack of outdoor seating, the staff at Eggslut warmly welcomed Toby and me inside the restaurant.

item.title: Quiet and Challenging: Franklin Canyon
item.description: Franklin Canyon is an expansive park within the beautiful Beverly Hills landscape with an abundance of picnic areas and scenic trails. It’s a haven for hiking enthusiasts, catering to those with a moderate level of fitness and a love for outdoor exploration. Directions to the Hastain Trail Explore the Franklin Canyon Hastain Trail, located at the southern edge of the vast Franklin Canyon. Accessible from Santa Monica Blvd or Sunset Blvd, head north on North Beverly Dr until it splits into Franklin Canyon Dr.

item.title: Coffee and Stroll: UCLA Botanical Garden
item.description: The UCLA Botanical Garden is a hidden gem nestled within the vibrant campus of the University of California, Los Angeles. This enchanting garden offers a serene escape from the bustling city, with its diverse collection of plants and tranquil pathways. Dog-Friendly Coffee Shop Venture beyond the usual Starbucks corners in Westwood Village, and discover the world of cozy coffee shops. When searching for a dog-friendly spot, Toby and I stumbled upon Espresso Profeta, which has an outdoor area where we could sit in the sunshine together.

item.title: Picnic and Pictures: Griffith Park
item.description: Griffith Park is an iconic park in Los Angeles with an extensive network of trails, perfect for hiking, walking, and exploring with your furry companion. From the stunning views of the Hollywood Sign to the serene tranquility of the Griffith Observatory, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. Plus, there is no entrance fee! Entrance & Parking One option is the main entrance on Los Feliz Blvd, marked by the iconic bear statue.

item.title: Dog-Friendly Walks Near West Holllywood
item.description: Join Toby and me as we explore the wonders of Los Angeles, venturing within a 10-mile radius of West Hollywood, to discover our top three favorite spots. Picnic and Pictures: Griffith Park Griffith Park, nestled in the heart of Los Angeles, is an iconic park with a network of trails that are just perfect for leisurely strolls and exploration alongside your furry companion. As you wander along the park’s trails, prepare to be captivated by breathtaking vistas, including the world-famous Hollywood Sign and the Griffith Observatory.

item.title: Dog Trip to Santa Barbara
item.description: Santa Barbara is a charming coastal city, just a short two-hour drive north from Los Angeles. We spent a day visiting three beautiful dog-friendly spots to enjoy the city’s natural beauty and southern California’s delightful February weather. MacKenzie Dog Park Eager to let Toby stretch his legs leash-free after our lengthy drive to Santa Barbara, we first headed to the MacKenzie Dog Park. While dedicated parking wasn’t readily available, luck was on our side as we found street parking on State Street.

item.title: Dog-Friendly Trail of Crystal Cove
item.description: Immerse yourself in the natural beauty of Crystal Cove State Park in Newport Beach. Its dog-friendly paved trail along miles of Pacific coastline is a perfect place for an afternoon walk with your furry companion. Directions to the Dog-Friendly Trail While many trails in Crystal Cove State Park unfortunately don’t welcome our furry friends, there’s a ray of sunshine for dog owners – the dog-friendly paved Crystal Cove Trail by Pelican Point!

item.title: Bootstrap elements
item.description: Hinode provides several shortcodes that wrap common Bootstrap components. Refer to the official documentation for more details. Accordion As an example, the following shortcode displays an accordion with three elements, of which the first element is expanded. Accordion Item #1 This is the first item’s accordion body. It supports HTML content. The item is shown by adding the value show to the class argument. Accordion Item #2 This is the second item’s accordion body.

item.title: Template
item.description: Hinode is available as a template, and a main theme. The template uses npm to link to the latest available version of the Hinode theme. As such, it is less applicable if you plan to customize a lot. Vice versa, the main theme allows for heavy customization, but is not synchronized with the latest available Hinode theme automatically.

item.title: About
item.description: Toby, co-founder Born on October 16, 2020, Toby is a 30-lb, Shar Pei-Beagle (Sharpeagle) mix with a nose for adventure. His passion for exploration often leads him to uncover hidden scents and sprint across open fields with boundless joy. Don’t be fooled by his innocent gaze, though. Toby has a knack for transforming dolls and toys into delightful piles of fluff. When the sun graces the sky, you’ll find him basking in its warm glow, lazily indulging in afternoon naps.
